title: Part Time Key Holder - Cotton On Roosevelt Field Shopping Centre
description:
Be Who You Are. Love What You Do.


We are calling on all team mates who want more than a job. We are serious about our people, our customers, and the planet, and we want to do Good things together.


Australian roots - **Garden City, NY** residence!


NY: This is a part time hourly paid position with a wage range of $17.00 - $19.00 /hr


**COTTON ON GROUP, OUR CULTURE:**

A diverse crew of 20,000+ team members around the world who love to think big and have fun along the way. We develop, reward and recognize our team members, so they can feel empowered to reach their full potential. We know life’s more fun when you’re free to be you, and when you’re here, you’re celebrated for bringing your whole self to the team. YOU are what makes us the unique global retailer we are today.


**Cotton On**

Cotton On was brought to life in 1991 and we’re the founding brand of our Cotton On Group family. We have grown to nearly 800 stores across the globe and we still love exceeding our customers’ expectations with value-fashion in womenswear, menswear and accessories. Our Cotton On Brand exists to deliver on-trend basics through fast, fun fashion; all while having fun along the way.


**MORE THAN A JOB**

We don’t like words… we like action…80% of our global positions are filled by promotions of our existing team members because we believe that being YOU can take you places at Cotton On.


We are excited to share this opportunity, and to welcome a new teammate to the Group to help build on our strong culture and purpose led vision to make a positive difference in people’s lives.


**Key Holder**

Our store teams are the enablers for our customers to experience the difference of a Cotton On (Brand) Store. Here everyone is welcome and appreciated.


You drive the amazing message of our Foundation and how our teams and customer are making life changing impact in our projects around the world.


You bring your commercial eye to the store, spot opportunities, support and enable the team around you.


Reporting to the Store Manager, but accountable to our Management team in store, our Key Holders are responsible for enabling the store to perform at its best through the support of our Management teams direction and execution of core tasks. Our Key Holders provide critical support and inspire our teams to work efficiently together. *Key Holders will not be responsible for establishing any store policies or evaluating employees’ performance through written documentation.*

**Skills & Experience:**

* A Passion for product, brands, fashion and trends!
* Experience in Retail, preferably fast fashion experience
* 1+ years of supervisory experience is preferred. Demonstrated knowledge / ability to inspire, motivating and lead diverse and high performing teams
* Demonstrated result and acumen in understanding sales, stock and service delivery in stores
* Knowledge of retail merchandising practices, including the ability to execute VM directives and deliver on world class visual merchandising standards with your team
* Ability to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the business, including evening, weekend and holiday shifts
* Strong communication, customer service, and problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast paced, ever changing environment
* Must be at least 18 /16 years of age or older to apply

**THE BENEFITS:**

* 50% Team Member discount for all Brands/Products
* Competitive Pay
* Wellness Support 24/7
* Performance & Peak incentives to reward & recognise our team
* Great benefits for YOU & your family – Medical, Dental, Vision + more
* 401(k) matching program, with a commitment to financial literacy and support
* Development opportunities that could take you anywhere
* Quarterly COG Awards + real time recognition

**DOING GOOD MATTERS:**

Making a positive difference in people’s lives is our purpose. It’s what gets us out of bed in the morning and drives our every move. (Kind of like a really strong cup of coffee!). It’s not just how we do business, it’s part of who we are.


The Good is a movement to create meaningful change and channel our focus on the things that matter most. It’s our work in building sustainable futures, and supporting and protecting our people and the planet. It’s about celebrating differences while strengthening connections, because we know we’re stronger together.


Our Foundation is at the heart of this, and together, we have raised over $120m for life changing projects around the world - all thanks to our teams and customers.


Being a part of our team is more than a job. As we say here at Cotton On Group; Be yourself, it’ll change the world.


**Come join our Aussie brand and make your mark. Apply today!**

To learn more about us, please visit us at https://cottonongroup.com.au/ and for more on the Good we are doing, and our Foundation and the work being done here, please head to https://cottonongroup.com.au/the-good-we-do/ and https://cottonongroup.com.au/cotton-on-foundation/


Cotton On Group is an equal opportunity employer, who believes that the future of our organisation depends on building a diverse, representative and inclusive team. We strongly encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Should you need any reasonable accommodations through the interview process, please let us know by contacting USAHumanResources@cottonon.com.au


In addition, Cotton On Group will consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with local “Fair Chance” ordinances.


  
ABOUT US  

  

 From Australia to the world - The Cotton On Group (known in-house as COG) is Australia's largest global retailer. With 7 brands, 19 countries, 1500 stores and counting; we exist to make a positive difference in the lives of everyone we touch. Our people are optimistic, innovative and highly motivated; they share a genuine belief in themselves and others and they aren't afraid to think big.


  
ABOUT THE TEAM  

  

 Cotton On is the founding brand of the Group and has grown to become a global fashion destination with over 600 stores worldwide. We thrive on delivering the trends of the moment (always with our own twist) and inspire our community to have fun with it. Our product offering includes womenswear, menswear and accessories.

title: Store Assistant Manager
description:
As an Assistant Store Manager, provide support to the store manager in the management of store operations. In support of the store manager, he/she is responsible for store staff shift management, labor hour control, human resource development, product ordering, inventory control, and operational management of product development. He/she is also responsible for ensuring compliance with store laws and regulations, and accurately reporting any store problems or issues to the store manager and instructors.


**Essential Functions:**


* Improvement of customer service quality, customer relations, cleanliness, implementation
* Recruitment, leadership staff training, staff counseling, and building effective work operations
* Management and supervision of staff, compliance with company rules and regulations, monitoring and guidance of working conditions and attitudes, and shift management
* Appropriate ordering, creation of sales areas that do not run out of stock, loss control, and inventory control
* Execution and management of sales plans, merchandise organization, and merchandise replenishment management
* Sales goal, basket counts, MH, loss, inventory turnover days
* Cash register float money management/Safe money management
* Management and organize forms, documents, manuals, files, and records
* Store, equipment and fixtures management
* Store security, crime prevention, store interior/BR organization and tidiness
* Management and control based on guidelines developed by the company.


**Education Requirements**



High school Diploma/GED


**Work Experience Requirements:**



2+ Years


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:**


* Previous experience as a sales associate
* Experience in inventory oversight
* Strong communication skills and building good relationships
* Ability to achieve sales goals
* Ability to respond to the speed of change in the store/company
* Execution of head office information and instructions
* Able to lead store problems to a positive resolution
* Positive attitude, reliability, and cooperativeness in work
* Must be flexible to work evenings and weekend shifts

title: 2025 Fall Associate – Accounting and Financial Advisory
description:
The Associate position is a full-time entry level consulting staff position. Associate positions are for candidates with an expected graduation date between December 2024 and July 2025.**Overview**

Berkeley Research Group (BRG) is a global consulting firm that helps its clients, which consist of leading organizations and businesses, advance in three key areas: disputes and investigations, corporate finance, and performance improvement and advisory. We are an integrated group of experts, industry leaders, academics, data scientists, and economists, working beyond borders and disciplines. We harness our collective expertise to deliver the inspired insights and practical strategies our clients need to stay ahead of what’s next.

Associate positions are available in BRG’s Business Insurance Claims (BIC), Financial Institutions Advisory (FIA), Forensic Accounting & Valuation, and Government Contracts (GovCon). These groups are comprised of a diverse collection of experts who bring extensive academic and industry experience to deliver data driven and innovative approaches to complex business, legal, and regulatory challenges. They interact to deliver unique and insightful perspectives to our clients across various industries. Candidates can select a preferred group as part of the application process. Further information on each consulting opportunity include:* Business Insurance Claims (BIC) – BRG’s BIC experts are often retained immediately after a catastrophe to provide advice and guidance to the policyholder in the recovery process and to prepare claims. Our experts analyze detailed financial and accounting records and operations data; develop financial models to assess losses; and prepare insurance claims that are comprehensive and well documented, and support resolution and payment of complex claims.
* Financial Institutions Advisory (FIA) – BRG’s FIA practice specializes in helping financial institutions (including banks, broker dealers, and money services businesses),government and regulatory bodies, and fintech firms solve pressing industry and regulatory issues. The group brings a mix of functional experts—including former regulators, financial modelers, technologists, former bankers, and longtime consultants—to address immediate risks and drive tangible benefits.
* Forensic Accounting & Valuation – BRG’s Forensic Accounting & Valuation experts use their forensic accounting and financial expertise, to evaluate the financial and operational records of global organizations in various industries and provide expert evidence and testimony in many jurisdictions. BRG’s Forensic Accounting & Valuation experts are adept at translating complex financial transactions and numerical data into terms that a layperson can understand and interpret in a legal setting. Our forensic accounting experts apply their understanding of industry, accounting, finance, and economics to address complex issues that arise in dispute resolution in areas such as forensic and fraud investigations, commercial damages, bankruptcies, intellectual property, insurance claims, and business valuations.
* Government Contracts (GovCon) – BRG’s GovCon group advises clients on matters that span the entire lifecycle of a government procurements, focusing primarily on complex costing and pricing matters, restructuring cost accounting practices, responding to regulatory audits, and award close-outs. The group brings intelligent, innovative solutions combined with a focus on financial expertise, regulatory interpretation and compliance, to the issues clients face including successful resolution of government audits, investigations, disputes, and suspension and debarment. Our consultants help clients in virtually every industry pursue and succeed in business with Federal, State and International Government entities by advising them on successfully navigating the complex financial challenges, regulations and policies and adapting commercial business practices to accommodate regulatory and donor requirements.
**Responsibilities*** Work directly with clients analyzing various financial cost and pricing-related challenges
* Assist clients with critical accounting, contract administration, and strategic business assessments. Develop customized solutions addressing critical objectives while also enhancing client operational effectiveness and profitability.
* Perform detailed research and analysis, then put the results into action (e.g., gather, review and summarize literature and data from the public domain, specialized industry resources, or client, public and commercial databases).
* Develop and maintain electronic databases, spreadsheets and other files as dictated by project needs. Develop support for litigation and dispute resolution, including forensic accounting analyses.
* Apply critical thinking skills.
* Audit own work product and work product of others to assure quality.
* Participate in a team environment and work hard to meet client deadlines and quality expectations.
* Demonstrate strong organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.
* Participate in group practice meetings and travel as needed.
* Demonstrate creativity and efficient use of relevant software tools, analytical methods, and computer models to develop solutions.
* Assist in the analysis of financial statements, general ledgers, and other financial documents to determine if accounting malpractice or fraud is indicated.
* Evaluate historical and projected financial performance in connection with determination of damages or diminution of value.
* Assist in the preparation of expert witness reports to support opinions based on industry research and knowledge, data analysis, and financial modeling.
**Qualifications*** Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in the areas of accounting, finance, statistics, economics, statistics or other related subject.
* 3.5 GPA or higher.
* 0-2 years of experience including internships.
* Capability with MS Excel and PowerPoint.
* Willingness to consider becoming a CPA.
* Experience with relational database program(s) (e.g., MS SQL Server, MS Access, MySQL, Oracle, Teradata) or statistical analysis programs (e.g., SAS, SPSS, Stata, R, Python) is preferred. A desire to expand those capabilities is required.
* Desire to work within a team environment.

**Locations:**
This position is based in one of BRG’s offices and requires working with colleagues in the office three to four days a week, on average. The office location varies for each of the communities listed above:* Business Insurance Claims (BIC) – Emeryville, CA and New York, NY
* Financial Institutions Advisory (FIA) – Washington, DC and New York, NY
* Forensic Accounting & Valuation – Houston, TX
* Government Contracts (GovCon) - Washington, DC


Salary Range: $75,000-100,000


Candidate must be able to submit verification of his/her legal right to work in the United States, without company sponsorship now or in the future.

BRG was named a 2024 Campus Forward Award Winner for Large Early Career Programs by Ripplematch. This award recognizes excellence in early career hiring, celebrating programs that embrace innovative recruitment strategies, make significant investments in diversity and inclusion, and support the next generation of talent through impactful internships and entry-level programs.

BRG is a recipient of the Human Rights Campaigns Equality 100 Award for our LGBTQ+ corporate policies, practices and beliefs.

title: MERCHANDISER
description:
**OVERVIEW:**



This role exists to help shape the North America Commercial function, maintaining best in class merchandising and buying standards and determining the best product for the market.


*Please note t**his* *is a hybrid* *role partially based in our New York City office. All candidates must be local or willing to relocate. You must also be authorized to work in the United States**.*


**WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:**


**Responsible For:**


* Strategic assortment building and investing for the NAM market based on hindsights, completive analysis and company targets
* Developing and maintaining relationships with relevant stakeholders and functions across the NAM region and global
* Managing inventory flows to support the execution of monthly Open-to-Buy objectives and inputs
* Management and analysis of selling trends, reorder process within specific distribution center data
* Monitor warehouse stock flow delivery timing
* Analysis of competitive landscape and market trends
* Site management – monitor eComm execution of product storytelling on site
* Collaborating with relevant stakeholders for product launches, marketing pushes and day to day needs
* Developing excel based tools to better track imagery, Shopify data and general inventory for NAM region


**Accountable For:**


* Identifying white space opportunity and prescribing product fit for NAM consumer
* Increase profitability and satisfaction of market needs
* Data reporting and analysis of competitive market trends
* Increase sales performance


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED:**


**Essential Skills & Experience:**


* 3-5 years merchandising experience
* Skilled in Excel and building PowerPoint decks
* Clear and concise presentation skills
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* High attention to detail and time management
* Experience in people management a plus


**ABOUT US.**



We’re here to unite the conditioning community. We believe that putting the sweat in today, prepares us for tomorrow. So, we give people the tools they need to reach further, go faster, be stronger. We celebrate those who show up – for themselves – to be their physical or mental best, whatever that means for them. It’s what we want for our community, and our team. A team that’s growing rapidly around the world. A collective of talented individuals working together to invent Gymshark’s future. Our plans are ambitious, and we’re looking for people who want to join us for the ride – our growth will be your growth.


**THE PERKS.**



At Gymshark we believe in the importance of investing in our employees through their physical, mental, and financial health along with being able to provide some fun and inclusive perks along the way.


**This role has a salary range between $80,000-$90,000. The base pay offered is based on market, experience, and skills.**



Part of our compensation package includes a discretionary annual company performance bonus. We are also able to offer our employees and their families a comprehensive medical, dental, and vision package. Gymshark provides company paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, and our Sharks also receive a generous 401K match to help them save for their retirement.



Gymshark will continue to support our employees’ overall wellbeing through several perks including 20 days of paid time off (plus your birthday), 11 holidays, transportation allowance, wellbeing program, and a 50% discount on all Gymshark items. We hope you consider joining our growing family in New York City.


* *All benefits are non-contractual, and Gymshark may amend, terminate, or enhance the benefits provided you and our other employees from time to time as it deems appropriate.*


**BELONGING AT GYMSHARK.**



Our mission is to be a place where everyone belongs. We’re an equal opportunities employer, and for us that means we always strive to be as inclusive as possible in all aspects of employment, right from your application. We’re committed to finding reasonable adjustments\\* for candidates with specific needs or have a disability during our recruitment process, and all applicants will be considered fairly and equally. We do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. \\*If you’d like to request a reasonable adjustment please email peopleteamusa@gymshark.com.

title: Youth ACT Clinician
description:
**Location:** Goshen, NY**Hours:** Full-Time**Salary:** $74,880 (LMSW/LCSW/LMHC) **OVERVIEW OF PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITES****:**

  

We are looking for a dynamic Youth Assertive Community Treatment (ACT) Licensed Mental Health Professional who is passionate about working closely with youth ages 10-21 with acute behavioral health needs. The Youth ACT Team is a program designed to address the significant needs of children/youth who are at risk of entering, or returning home from high intensity services, such as inpatient or residential services, through the use of a multi-disciplinary team. Youth ACT services are delivered in the home or other community based settings. Youth ACT teams deliver intensive, highly coordinated, individualized services and skilled therapeutic interventions through an integrated, multidisciplinary team approach to better achieve success and maintain the child in the home, school and community.


The Licensed Mental Health Professional is responsible for providing clinical treatment and working with their Youth ACT team colleagues to follow the mission of providing the child and their family with the level of support and access to services required to sustain gains made in crisis response or other out of-home high-intensity services.


**PRIMARY FUNCTIONS****:** The Youth ACT Licensed Mental Health Professional will:  

  

  



* Conduct assessments and provide person centered, trauma-informed and culturally humble treatment, including crisis intervention to participants.
* Participate in staff meetings, daily clinical case conferences, and other agency or program meetings, including coordinating with other service providers/schools, family members, etc., as necessary.
* Assure timely and satisfactory completion of documentation in electronic charts and case records.
* Participate in a weekly on-call rotation.

**QUALIFICATIONS AND ATTRIBUTES****:**

* Ability to manage multiple simultaneous work demands in an effective and professional manner.
* Ability to work well independently, while collaborating with other team members.
* Ability and willingness to self-motivate, prioritize, and change processes to improve effectiveness.
* Excellent writing skills.
* Computer literacy.
* Ability to navigate Electronic Health Records and other systems.
* Bi-lingual in English and Spanish, preferred but not required.

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE****:**

* NYS License in one of the following categories: Psychologist, Clinical/Masters Social Worker, Marriage and Family Therapist, Mental Health Counselor, or Creative Arts Therapist
* Experience working with youth and their families both individually and as a group
* Experience working in community based settings, preferred
* Familiarity with the Orange County System of Services, preferred

**PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS****:**

* Must have reliable transportation and be able to respond to client needs, in person, within an hour during scheduled work and on-call hours.

  

EEO, AAE, M/F/D/V

title: Mobile Response Crisis Team Clinician
description:
**Location**: New Rochelle, NY  

  

**MCRT Clinician- LMSW, LMHC or LCSW**

***Hours: M-F 830 am to 430 pm***  

  

**Rate of Pay:** $$65,000 LP - 75,000 (LMHC, LCSW, LMFT or LMSW)

**Position Summary**: The Guidance Center of Westchester’s Mobile Crisis Response Teams (MCRT) in **New Rochelle/**catchment area and **Mt. Vernon**/catchment area act as Emergency First Responder Providers for those in the community that are experiencing a mental health, substance use disorder crisis that includes suicide risk. The calls come from Police who have received 911 calls for assistance and there is close collaboration with the corresponding Police departments. The Mobile Crisis Response teams will be prepared 24/7 to respond to crises in person or at times when appropriate by telephone.

**Position Responsibilities:**

* Dispatch to mental health crises in New Rochelle and Mt. Vernon
* Assess, engage, de-escalate and stabilize people and situations.
* Help people get linked to services.
* Interface with community leaders, police department and providers.
* Assessment of behavioral health symptoms and crisis related needs.
* Development of a safety plan or crisis prevention plan.
* Work in compliance with Mobile Crisis Response Team, agency, and regulatory procedural guidelines.

**Qualifications:**

* A Master’s Degree and New York State Licensure as an LMSW, LCSW or LMHC required
* Unlicensed Clinicians can be considered.
* Skills in clinical triage and assessment of emergency, urgent, and routine calls.
* Familiarity with Westchester resources to support a variety of complex needs.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Positive attitude and demeanor
* A passion for engaging with community members as well as team members
* EEO, AAE, M/F/D/V

title: Supply Marketing Associate
description:
***About Us***
--------------


Screenverse stands as the world's largest and most diverse digital screen network. Our approach blends top-tier technology with exceptional talent to optimize the monetization of digital screens in the physical world for our networks. As programmatic experts, we provide a streamlined experience through a single access point, offering expansive reach through our extensive coverage and delivering comprehensive support alongside strategic collaboration.

***Summary of Job’s Purpose***
------------------------------


Screenverse is looking for a detail-oriented and creative Supply Marketing Associate to join our team. This entry-level role is pivotal in enhancing our brand presence by creating high-quality visual content, maintaining updated marketing materials, and collaborating on strategic initiatives. The ideal candidate will be passionate about storytelling and ensuring that our partners’ stories are effectively communicated, supporting our sales efforts with precise and compelling information.

***The Position:***
-------------------

**Strategy & Storytelling:**

* **Collaborative Storytelling:** Partner with senior leadership to develop and execute innovative strategies that effectively communicate our partners' stories, with the goal of increasing sales and enhancing brand presence.

**Collaboration:**

* **SSP Team Collaboration:** Work closely with the SSP team to identify, track, and disseminate newsworthy announcements for each of our partners, ensuring information is timely and accurate.
* **Sales Team Support:** Collaborate with the sales team to create and update custom decks and one-sheets tailored for brands and agencies, ensuring all materials are aligned with the latest strategies and offerings.

**Marketing Materials Management:**

* **Screenverse Network One-Sheets, Media Kit & Custom Decks:**


	+ **Inventory Updates:** Regularly update marketing materials to reflect new inventory from partners, ensuring materials are refreshed at least monthly.
	+ **Website Content:** Ensure all website information is current and accurately represents our offerings.
	+ **One-Sheets:** Develop and maintain various one-sheets according to the content calendar, ensuring all materials meet high standards of quality and accuracy.
	+ **Media Owner One-Sheets:** Conduct in-depth research to create comprehensive one-sheets for media owners, effectively highlighting their strengths and value propositions.

**Visual Content & Proof of Play:**

* **Photoshop Templates:** Continuously update Photoshop templates with high-quality images, ensuring the Customer Success (CS) team has all necessary materials to support their efforts.
* **Live Proof of Play (POP):** Lead the capture of live POP when required, or coordinate with outsourced photographers to ensure timely and high-quality content.

***The Requirements:***
-----------------------

* Strong proficiency in visual content creation tools, including Adobe Photoshop.
* Excellent organizational skills with a strong attention to detail.
* Ability to work collaboratively across multiple teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Experience in marketing, content creation, or a related field is preferred.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Whilst we are a remote team, the ideal candidate will be based in or be a commutable distance from any of the following cities: Los Angeles, New York, Atlanta, Denver, Washington, D.C, Chicago, Dallas-Fort Worth, Houston, Boston, San Francisco, Seattle, Miami, or Philadelphia.

*Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other job-related qualifications. The estimated base salary range for this position is $55K to $65K.*


Screenverse is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants shall receive equal consideration regardless of race, color, religion, gender, marital status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, veteran status, or disability.


Compensation Range: $55K - $65K

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
**About Roam**
--------------


Our mission at Roam is to make homeownership 2x more affordable for 1 million Americans by 2030. We help buyers wind back the clock on interest rates by purchasing a home with a low-rate assumable mortgage, a type of loan where the buyer can take over the mortgage terms from the seller. All government-backed loans such as FHA and VA loans are eligible for assumption by law, and there are millions of these loans at rates below 4%. With a low-rate assumable mortgage, buyers can save up to 50% on monthly payments compared to buying with a traditional mortgage at today’s rates.


Roam helps buyers find these homes for sale with the first-ever listing platform for homes with assumable mortgages. In addition, Roam manages all steps in the assumption process, acting as a specialized transaction coordinator to quarterback the entire process end-to-end on behalf of buyer and seller to ensure they close on time.

**About the role**
------------------


Roam is leading the way in the assumable mortgage category and has generated overwhelming interest and demand from the press and consumers. As our product marketing manager, you will have the opportunity to develop and execute a range of marketing strategies and tactics at all stages of the funnel to drive awareness, generate leads, and convert them through the funnel.


To be successful, you must have a proven track record in developing and executing impactful marketing campaigns with an emphasis on growth, lifecycle and content marketing. You’ll need experience in cross-functional operations, demand generation and campaign go-to-market, as you’ll be laying the foundation for the marketing function at Roam and tapping into your skills as a marketing athlete daily.


You will be expected to:

* Own our lifecycle marketing strategy and execution. Partner closely with Head of Marketing, Product and Operations teams to develop and optimize customer flows and communications to effectively nurture and convert leads through the funnel.
* Be a great storyteller through positioning, content, and messaging that succinctly communicates how Roam works, and clearly articulates our value and positioning to various audiences.
* Oversee the development and execution of content marketing campaigns across Roam channels, including our blogs, website, and emails, to reach audiences at every stage of the customer journey—educate, generate interest and demand, and convert leads through the funnel.
* Develop and implement SEO strategies to improve organic search results and traffic to our website, including website structural optimization, web content, and traffic/backlink building efforts.
* Grow Roam’s reach through social platforms as a tool to listen, engage, and amplify the company’s thought leadership and storytelling.


After 1 month you will…

* Be up to speed on the business and team. You’ll work with Roam’s leadership team to define marketing objectives and develop a comprehensive marketing plan aligned with the company's vision and goals.
* Have a keen understanding of our brand and product positioning to clearly articulate our value and positioning and how Roam works to various audiences. You’ll develop messaging that succinctly describes how Roam works for each customer segment and write and ship a range of marketing content, including emails, web copy, PR pitches, and more.
* Be up to speed on Roam’s marketing technology stack (e.g., HubSpot) and executing campaigns leveraging these tools. You’ll identify and recommend new tools to help us efficiently scale the marketing function.
* Establish your reporting approach by identifying key performance indicators (KPIs), and tools for regularly tracking and reporting on marketing efforts across domains/channels such as content, PR, SEO, social media, lifecycle marketing, and more.


After 3 months you will…

* Deliver and execute a series of lifecycle campaigns that drive demand for Sales, including customer reengagement programs and drip campaigns.
* Significantly grow Roam’s reach through social platforms (e.g., X, LinkedIn) as a channel to listen, engage, and amplify the company’s thought leadership and storytelling.
* Oversee the development and execution of content marketing campaigns across Roam channels in support of our SEO strategy, including our blogs, website, and emails, to reach audiences at every stage of the customer journey—educate, generate interest and demand, and convert leads through the funnel.
* Implement a lifecycle marketing strategy that drives measurable results and growth for the business. Partner closely with Product and Operations teams to develop and optimize customer flows and communications to effectively nurture and convert leads through the funnel.
* Develop and execute a framework for reporting key metrics, campaign effectiveness, and ROI for the surface areas you own Optimize and refine campaigns to maximize the business impact of marketing efforts and provide ongoing recommendations about marketing investments.

**About you**
-------------


We value bold, self-directed people who carry themselves with urgency. Our team has a bias for action, a need for speed, and a soft spot for those who sweat the details. To change the way we buy homes will require courage and conviction. If you have both, we hope you will join us. We think if you have the following skills, experience, and attributes you’d be successful at Roam:

* **Experience.** You have a minimum of four years of experience in marketing, primarily across product marketing, content marketing, and lifecycle marketing. You have a portfolio of writing samples and campaigns with measurable results. You have a deep understanding of product marketing, email/lifecycle marketing, content marketing, affiliate marketing, channel partnerships, social media, and SEO strategies, tactics, and tools. Expertise with HubSpot is a huge plus.
* **Comfort with Speed and Ambiguity.** We’re an early-stage startup, so you’ll constantly be navigating new challenges and need to be comfortable moving extraordinarily quickly.
* **Analytical**. You’re data-driven and results-oriented. You have experience developing and analyzing marketing campaigns to understand what works and optimize performance. You know how to create frameworks for testing, learning, optimizing, and understanding messaging ROI.
* **Excellent writer**. You can translate complex concepts into digestible and easy-to-understand messaging for a range of content types. You can craft crisp and compelling product and marketing content that communicates effectively and consistently in our brand voice. This includes copy for web, content, collateral, emails, social media, and more. You have an attention to detail around words and ensuring all of our messaging is high quality and consistent.
* **Ownership Mentality.** You’re a strong project manager with a clear point of view. You are self-directed and carry yourself with a sense of urgency. You know how to identify and prioritize needs and do what it takes to ensure that urgent and important needs are acted on immediately.

*The heart of our mission is addressing inequity in housing affordability. We’re here to change the status quo through the company we build and the products we launch. We celebrate a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds on our team in order to reflect the customers we serve. We are an opportunity employer.*


Compensation Range: $110K - $125K

title: Brand Marketing Associate
description:
***About Us***
--------------


Screenverse stands as the world's largest and most diverse digital screen network. Our approach blends top-tier technology with exceptional talent to optimize the monetization of digital screens in the physical world for our networks. As programmatic experts, we provide a streamlined experience through a single access point, offering expansive reach through our extensive coverage and delivering comprehensive support alongside strategic collaboration.

***Summary of Job’s Purpose***
------------------------------


Screenverse is seeking a creative and detail-oriented Brand Marketing Associate to join our dynamic marketing team. This entry-level role is essential for developing and executing initiatives that enhance and solidify Screenverse’s brand presence in the marketplace. The ideal candidate will have a passion for content creation, strategic collaboration, and driving brand growth through consistent and impactful communication.

***The Position:***
-------------------

**Content Development:**

* **Website:** Conduct research and develop blogs, landing pages, and additional content that will boost SEO performance and provide value to our visitors and target audiences.
* **Email Marketing:** Design and implement a robust email communication strategy, including the creation of monthly email newsletters tailored to specific target audiences such as media owners, media buyers, and marketers.
* **Presentation Support:** Assist in the development of compelling presentation deliverables that effectively communicate our brand and value proposition.
* **Editorial Calendar:** Build and manage quarterly and annual editorial calendars for various content types, including email, social media, blog posts, one-sheets, and more, ensuring a steady stream of fresh, relevant content.

**Social Media Management:**

* **Organic Social Media:** Refine and execute Screenverse’s social media strategy by creating engaging content, managing daily community interactions, and analyzing performance metrics. Provide monthly reports to track and optimize social media efforts.

**Strategic Collaboration:**

* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Work strategically with cross-functional teams, including sales, customer success, and supply partnerships, to ensure cohesive and successful marketing execution across all channels.
* **Event Planning:** Collaborate closely with the marketing team to identify, plan, and organize events for the sales and marketing teams. Create and manage marketing collateral to support these events, ensuring they align with our brand strategy and goals.

***The Requirements:***
-----------------------

* Experience in content creation, social media management, and email marketing.
* Strong understanding of SEO best practices and content optimization.
* Proficient in using social media platforms and tools for content creation and performance analysis.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
* Whilst we are a remote team, the ideal candidate will be based in or be a commutable distance from any of the following cities: Los Angeles, New York, Atlanta, Denver, Washington, D.C, Chicago, Dallas-Fort Worth, Houston, Boston, San Francisco, Seattle, Miami, or Philadelphia.

*Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other job-related qualifications. The estimated base salary range for this position is $55K to $65K.*


Screenverse is An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants shall receive equal consideration regardless of race, color, religion, gender, marital status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, veteran status, or disability.


Compensation Range: $55K - $65K

title: Growth Lead
description:
Pillar protects global businesses from macroeconomic risk by automatically hedging their freight, currency, and commodities exposure.


Risk management plays a critical role in the functioning of any business. In the past 4 years, volatility across these asset classes - swings from +20% to 450% - has wreaked havoc on SMEs who rely on them to function. Yet, the solutions needed to limit the effects of this volatility – seasoned traders and investment banking services – remain in the hands of the few: billion dollar companies with unlimited resources. Pillar solves this by bringing protection previously available only for the largest corporations to the 30M+ SMEs worldwide who have $7T+ of underserved risk. With a few clicks, customers are able to manage their risks through Pillar’s seamless, end to end platform.


We’re on a mission to give all businesses Fortune 500-level financial services, starting with risk management, enabling them to focus on building their core business. We’ve raised $3M from world class investors like J Ventures, Neo, Graph Ventures, Ride Ventures, Expansion Ventures, the CEO of Uber and Co-Founder of Vanta, along with seasoned executives and operators from Stripe, Robinhood, and Airbnb.

**The Role**
============


We are looking for our first growth hire to put our product into the hands of more business owners, CFOs, and finance teams. As an early team member, you will play an indispensable role in augmenting our outbound to identify and reach potential customers that would benefit from Pillar. You will be responsible for identifying and prospecting new clients, closing new deals, generating top-of-funnel pipeline, and supporting existing customers.


Beyond being a key part of the sales process, you will work with us to experiment and validate new industries, customer segments, channel partners, and expand our presence at conferences, industry events, and social media. You will remain close with customers, working to ensure successful onboarding, product experience, and general support.


The ideal candidate will have experience performing in a demanding work environment, tackling complex, uncertain problems, and seeing difficult tasks through completion. Experience in customer-facing or sales roles along with excellent communication and management skills is a plus.

**Responsibilities:**
=====================

### **Execute Sales and Manage Pipeline**

* Conduct outbound pipeline generation by prospecting new accounts and leading initial discovery and qualification
* Qualify, advance, and close warm leads to establish a foundation for predictable revenue growth
* Achieve monthly targets for pipeline creation, lead qualification, and discovery meetings

### **Deal Execution & Analysis**

* Qualify leads, advance opportunities, and create tailored proposals to effectively communicate our value proposition and business impact, securing new clients
* Expertise in negotiating deals with legal and finance teams, supported by a strong business acumen
* Develop and implement sales messaging improvements and experiments leveraging both data analysis and creativity
* Analyze, improve, and innovate on sales processes to increase funnel conversions leveraging our CRM including building automated workflows, dashboards and reporting
* Identify patterns of successful deals by analyzing business metrics with the aim of refining the perfect GTM engine

### **New Business Expansion**

* Grow existing customer relationships and explore new areas to drive revenue growth
* Experiment and validate new business opportunities in terms of new industries, customer segments, channel partners
* Increase industry-specific awareness by enhancing Pillar’s presence at conferences, industry events, and social media

### **Steer Customer Success**

* Support the customer through onboarding, implementation, and beyond: be available for any and everything the customer needs
* Cultivate a deep understanding of the customer's business in order to speak their language
* Be well-prepared and knowledgeable about their priorities, initiatives, and challenges to maintain a solid relationship and effectively serve the customer
* Manage several stakeholders throughout the sales and implementation cycle

**Ideal Qualifications:**
=========================

* 1-2 years of experience in sales, investment banking, management consulting, trading or other industries that require stakeholder management
* Excellent written and verbal skills
* Be a people person - strong listener and talented communicator who has a strong awareness of those around you. You are thoughtful about the ways you communicate and the impression that may have on a client
* Strong comfort level with sales, prospecting and marketing tools & processes
* Exude empathy and a collaborative spirit in a high-paced environment
* A sense of deep curiosity: always keen on learning more about all aspects of the customer, domain, and product
* Bachelor’s degree


Nice to have:

* Prior experience with customer-facing or sales roles
* Prior experience in fintech, supply chain, or SMB sales
* Prior CRM experience
* Experience at a high-growth startup

### **Compensation and Benefits**


The annualized salary/OTE for the target level for this role is $100,000-$130,000 plus target equity and benefits. This salary range is based on the current available market data, and represents the expected salary range for this role. Actual compensation will vary based on skills, experience, and which offer each candidate selects.

title: Electrical / Electronic Technician
description:
Requisition ID: 33505
Location:
Garden City, US, 11530
**What You Can Expect**


As our Electrical / Electronic Tech, you will be responsible for maintenance and repair of plant instrumentation and controls. On both a preventative / reliability basis and for emergency service work.

  


Typically, job functions would include maintenance and repair of such equipment as generator instrumentation and controls, DCS and PLC systems, particularly Bailey Network 90 systems, combustion control systems, alarms, recorders, transmitters, computers. You will be reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor.

  


**What You’ll Bring**


* Must possess a high school diploma
* You have completed training as an instrumentation & controls technician; with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in maintenance of plant equipment
* You will implement and carry out required plant maintenance functions and repairs at various sites
* You have experience coordinating with the activities of other maintenance and operational personnel as required and will be capable of conducting all necessary actions and functions independently and without direct supervision
* You will troubleshoot complex electronic control equipment down to the individual printed circuit board and component
* You can perform other tasks as required to fulfill the operational and maintenance requirements of the various plants and equipment including housekeeping
* You will perform all duties consistent with safe work practices as is generally practiced in industrial environments, and in accordance with established Employer safety practices and regulations as delineated in the Employer’s Safety Manual.
* You will be required to work overtime to cover vacations, illnesses, absences and other operational or maintenance requirements
* You will train bargaining unit personnel not familiar with the plant to assist in their skill development
* You will perform administrative functions as required by the Maintenance Management system, supervision, or others

  




**Additional Details**


* This role requires attendance at a worksite on a daily basis
* Must possess a valid U.S. driver’s license/will drive company vehicle
* Must be willing and able to comply with all ENGIE ethics and safety policies
* This position consist of 20% of outdoor work, while performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions

  


**Compensation**


**Salary Range:** $60.91 USD hourly


Your position is part of a bargaining unit represented by IUOE- Local 30. Many of the terms and conditions of your employment, including but not limited to work scheduling, wages, vacation, sick leave, and other benefits, will be governed by a collective bargaining agreement (the “CBA”) between the Company and the union.

  


This represents the average expected pay range for a qualified candidate.


Actual offered salary may depend on geography, experience, industry knowledge, education, internal pay alignment, or other bona fide factors.

  


ENGIE complies with all federal, state, and local minimum wage laws. Actual salary offered may vary depending on geography, experience, education, internal pay alignment, or other bona fide factors.

  

In addition to base pay, this position is eligible for call out pay.

  


Your Talent Acquisition Partner can share more specific information regarding the benefits or the salary for the position based on the work location.

  


At ENGIE, we take your well-being seriously. Our comprehensive benefits package includes options for medical, dental, vision, life insurance, employer-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance, ESPP, generous paid time off including wellness days, holidays and leave programs. We also help you plan for retirement by offering a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with a company match. But that's not all – we're dedicated to the health and happiness of your entire family, offering supplemental benefits for full time employees that enhance emotional and physical well-being through all stages of life from family forming to caregiver benefits. Explore our benefits package to see how we can support you. Learn more.

  


**Why ENGIE?**


ENGIE North America isn’t just participating in the Zero-Carbon Transition, we’re leading it! Join us as we develop energy that is renewable, efficient, and accessible to everyone.

  

At ENGIE, our goal is to support, promote, and thrive on diversity, equity, and inclusion. We do so for the benefit of our employees, customers, products and services, and community. ENGIE is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we are firmly committed to creating an equitable and inclusive environment for all employees.

  

We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected status.

  

If you need assistance with this application or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at ENGIENA-ENGIEHR@engie.com. This email address is reserved for individuals with disabilities in need of assistance and is not a means of inquiry regarding positions or application status.

  

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this role at any time.

  


The safety of our employees is our number one priority. All employees at ENGIE have both a duty and the authority to STOP WORK if unsafe acts are observed.

title: Assisant Coach, Volleyball
description:
**Posting Details**
-------------------


Posting Summary
**Position Title** Assisant Coach, Volleyball
  

**Job Category** Part-Time Staff
  

**Range Minimum** 5,500
  

**Position Type** Seasonal
  

**Department** Athletics
  

**Job Summary**
Assist the Head Coach in all aspects of coaching and organizing the respective team, including  

pre-season training, supervision, elevation, and preparation for practices, competition, and post-season play.  

1. Recruitment  

a. Identify potential student-athletes by attending showcases and high school games.  

b. Bring potential student-athletes on campus, provide tours and meet with Head Coach and team student leader.  

c. Along with Head Coach, interact with Admissions and Financial Aid Offices to better direct potential student-athletes in processes.  

d. Represent program and department by attending CCM Open Houses, coaches’ meetings, and department functions as assigned by the Athletic Director.  

2. Take role in student-athlete academic success in working with Academic Advisor, cover study halls, monitor class attendance, and follow up on progress reports.  

3. Recruit and organize team managers to collect and track all sports statistics, including the uploading of game stats in a timely manner according to Conference Region, and NJCAA bylaws.  

4. Assist in organization of media day.  

5. Help maintain, keep track, and return of all supplies, equipment, and uniforms.  

6. Must be prepared to participate in weekends and occasional overnight games and possible National Tournaments.  

7. Serve as one of the college’s Campus Security Authorities, responsible for reporting to Public Safety any activities that may be considered criminal incidences.  

8. Other duties as specified by Athletic Director.  


  

**Qualifications - Education**
High School diploma required. Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
  

**Qualifications - Experience**
Experience with competitive playing or coaching experience, college-level-preferred. Prefer possession of coaching experience at the high school level or above.
  

**Qualifications - Skills**
Thorough understanding of modern coaching methods, designing game plans, and assigning student athletes to appropriate positions.  

  

Able to demonstrate effective recruitment techniques and assess talent of players being recruited.  

  

Defensive Driving Course and 15-passenger van safety course required upon acceptance of position. Must be able to operate a 15-passenger van for away contests and in some cases home contests off-site.  

  

DMV and criminal history background check required. Must be in good standing according to the Morris County Risk Management Department.  

  

Must have a flexible schedule to be present at all practices, home and away games.  


  

**Work Hours**
Seasonal from August through November

title: Receptionist - Financial Firm - Manalapan, NJ
description:
**Receptionist**
Are you dependable and highly detail-oriented with great interpersonal skills and a passion for client satisfaction? If you are looking for career satisfaction with a dynamic company, we have the opportunity for you! Our successful Financial Planning firm Dworetsky Financial in Manalapan, Township NJ is seeking a receptionist to ensure smooth day-to-day operations while providing superior customer service to the firm’s prospects, clients, and team members.
The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of office/administrative experience and be able to perform general tasks such as handling calls, calendar, and database management, and welcoming clients to the office.
This team member will be instrumental in ensuring clients have the most memorable, positive experience.
**Minimum Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required
* 2+ years of experience working in a professional office and fast-paced environment
* Proficient skills with MS Office Suite
* Comfortable and familiar with CRM platforms
* Industry experience preferred, but not required

**This position requires that you possess the following skills:**
* Strong organizational skills and strong attention to detail
* Proficient with filing, phone systems, faxing, and scanners
* Excellent communication skills; both verbal and written
* Calendar management
* Polished interpersonal and presentation competencies
* Exceptional phone skills
* Sincere and caring attitude
* Provide outstanding client service
* Thrive in a “time-sensitive” environment and adaptable to changes without affecting the quality of work

**Responsibilities:**  

This position will assist the Team in maintaining exceptional customer service to help exceed client and regulatory expectations by following day-to-day tasks such as:
* Answer phones and greet clients in a friendly, warm manner
* Ensure vendor supplies are stocked for client meetings
* Record notes from client conversations in an accurate manner
* Enter and maintain databases of clients and prospects
* Manage filing system
* Attend and contribute to team meetings
* Maintain the office environment in an immaculate and organized condition
* Maintain job-related/industry specific compliance files
* Assist in organizing events, event supplies, and promotional material
* Assist in the coordination of various vendor/client events
* Develop and mail letters to clients for various purposes upon request
* Prioritize daily tasks to be proactive in time management
* General backup support for all other positions consisting of varied tasks as needed


**Salary:**
* $40,000-$50,000


**Benefits:**
* Health Insurance
* Flex time possibly


**Hours:**
* Monday – Friday: 9:00 am – 5:00 pm
* Seminars possibly


**Presented by Advisor Employee Services** Thank you for your interest in the Receptionist role. Advisor Employee Services, a consulting firm located in Lenexa, Kansas, represents the top 1% of financial advisors in all 50 states in their hiring needs. Please take a moment to explore our website and the services provided https://aesplacement.com/. We are not a staffing firm, but together have built a reputable and continuously expanding business model which allows us to pinpoint the exact personnel needs of these established financial advisors. If you feel that you have the skills it takes for the position responsibilities listed, please apply today!

title: Patient Care Technician Instructor - Part-Time Project Employee
description:
Thank you for your interest in working at William Paterson University.
Overview of Position:
This part-time instructor position reports to the Associate Director of Professional Certificates & Training. This role provides patient care-related instruction in the classroom, ensuring that students gain the theoretical knowledge and practical skills required for certification and effective performance in a healthcare setting.
Major Duties and Responsibilities:* Teach on-site courses on patient care, including topics such as basic nursing skills, patient safety, vital signs monitoring, and patient communication.
* Deliver course and program learning outcomes as defined by program competencies according to the State of New Jersey rules and regulations regarding the certification requirements.
* Prepare students for the American Medical Certification Association (AMCA) exam using the program outline, competencies, and exam blueprint.
* Track student attendance, progress, and grades to assess and evaluate student performance and readiness for clinical practice and the certificate exam.
* Maintain accurate records of student attendance, progress, and grades.
* Develop course curriculum and content that aligns with industry standards and certificate requirements.
* Prepare and maintain instructional materials, including lectures, demonstrations, and practical exercises.
* Provide constructive feedback and guidance to students to support their learning and professional development.


Required Education and Experience:* 2-3 years of experience working in healthcare, Registered Nurse (RN), or Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) with experience as preceptor of student nurses.
* Experience using information technology including Microsoft Office Suite, Teams, Workday, Webex, and Zoom.


Preferred Qualifications:* Strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and solve problems effectively.
* Passion for teaching and a commitment to student success.
* Experience working with English language learners a plus.


Total Rewards:
Click here to view the total rewards of working at WP
William Paterson University is committed to protecting your privacy and will not sell your personal information.

title: Baggage Agent Lead
description:
Overview:
**dnata is hiring a Bagroom Agent Lead at JFK Airport!**

**Pay Rate $21.00/hr.**

 **\\* Weekly pay, 401K, paid time off, paid training and company uniforms \\***

  

We are “Reconnecting a Better World” through our best-in-class team of dedicated, passionate, and highly trained aviation professionals. We have been awarded “Ground Handler of the Year” for seven consecutive years and are committed to our Vision of being the world’s most admired air services provider. Led from our Global Headquarters in Dubai and with international and domestic operations spanning six continents, our Mission is to deliver the promises our customers make. If you’re looking for a highly rewarding career in aviation services, you’re looking for dnata!


dnata is one of the world’s largest air services providers. Established in 1959, the company ensures the aviation industry operates smoothly and efficiently in 129 airports. Offering ground handling, cargo, travel, and flight catering services in 35 countries across six continents, dnata is a trusted partner for over 300 airline customers around the world. Each day, the company handles over 1,900 flights, moves over 8,500 tons of cargo, books over 16,000 hotel stays, and uplifts over 320,000 meals
You Will:

As a dnata Baggage Agent Lead, you have the essential role of leading the bagroom, the unloading and
loading of luggage, freight, and cargo on and off commercial aircraft. Driving and operating small
specialized commercial vehicles.  

* Continuously lead and participate in the movement of cargo and baggage loading on and off aircraft and transport it between aircraft, outbound bagroom, airport terminals, air cargo facilities, and other aircraft
* Lift cargo weighing up to 70 lbs. when loading/unloading aircraft, carts, and containers
* Loading/unloading may require lifting over 100 items for a single aircraft
* Push/pull loaded and empty carts and containers during loading/unloading operations
* Couple/uncouple carts and/or cargo container dollies
* Ascend/descend jet-way stairs while carrying cargo
* Bend/stoop and crawl to move and stack/unstack cargo in aircraft and containers
* Stand for up to 4 hours in all weather conditions to upload or unload cargo and direct traffic
* Walk continuously to load/ unload cargo from pallets, containers, carts, or conveyor belts
* Complete safety checklists for motorized equipment
* Drive and operate motorized equipment (Tug, Belt Loader)
* Read and interpret aircraft load sheets, checked baggage tags, and cargo labels
* Operate a computer to enter and retrieve data for weight and balance purposes
* Count baggage/cargo being uploaded/ unloaded during operations
* Connect support equipment to aircraft such as PC Air, GPU etc.
* Use signaling devices to communicate with co-workers or flight crew
* Ensure compliance with dnata, TSA and Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) regulations and policies
* Other duties as assigned
* Can meet the Station’s attendance standards


You Have:
* Possess/maintain a valid State driver's license and other FAA/Airport required identification/seals or authorizations
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Must be flexible to work variable shifts, weekends, and holidays
* Specific shifts to be determined based on operational needs
* Must be able to work extended hours on short notice during irregular operation
* Ability to work in inclement weather
* Frequent bending, stretching push/pulling, stacking, and kneeling in small, confined locations.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty
satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or
ability required.
Diversity Matters:
**Equal Opportunity Employer**
dnata US is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive
consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin,
disability status protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Event Production Lead
description:
**About NYRR**
New York Road Runners (NYRR) was founded in 1958 when a small group of passionate runners vowed to bring running to the people and has grown from a local running club into the world’s premier community running organization. NYRR’s mission is to help and inspire through running, aiming to empower people of all ages and abilities to improve their health and well-being through the power of running and fitness.

NYRR’s year-round offerings of races, community events, programs, and training resources provide hundreds of thousands of people with the motivation, know-how, and opportunities to start running and keep running for life. NYRR’s premier event, the famed TCS New York City Marathon, attracts the world’s top professional runners and committed amateurs alike, while also raising millions of dollars annually for charity and driving economic impact for New York City. NYRR is equally committed to the runners of tomorrow, passionately providing youth fitness programs that educate and inspire children in underserved communities in New York City, nationwide, and around the world.

Headquartered in New York City, NYRR is a 501(c)(3) organization. To learn more, please visit www.nyrr.org.

*At New York Road Runners, we are committed to building an inclusive, diverse workplace by finding the best candidate for the job. We understand that skills come from a variety of different backgrounds. Checking off every single requirement on our job description is not necessary to apply. If you think you are a good fit and have a passion for the work we do, please submit your application. We are eager to learn about your experience and skills! You may be the right candidate for this or other open positions.*
*New York Road Runners is an Equal Opportunity Employer*
**About the Department**
The Event Development and Production Department (EDP) develops and produces NYRR events from concept all the way through execution in alignment with NYRR’s mission. The TCS New York City Marathon, United Airlines NYC Half and the RBC Brooklyn Half are just a few of the 40+ adult events and 30+ Rising New York Road Runners youth events produced by the team each year. The team leads core elements of the operations including physical site management, timing and scoring operations, volunteer management, hospitality and special events, safety and security, management of our warehouse and all race collateral, city and state agency relationship management, and permitting.
**About the Position**
This position will report to the Director, Event Production, with the core responsibility of managing, leading and producing NYRR events properties, including the TCS New York City Marathon.
*Job Responsibilities (primary and secondary duties):** Manage all aspects of the project life cycle for NYRR events: expense tracking and invoice reconciliation, site planning, permits/approvals, timelines, preparation of logistics, power and sound, vendor and contract management, execution of sponsorship activation plans and runner engagement activities and event execution. Post-event reconciliation and preparation of reports and recaps.
* Various roles for the Five Borough Series events and year-round planning for the TCS New York City Marathon
* Management and focus on sponsored and street events, in addition to Central Park and Prospect Park events.
* Develop and create site layouts using Google Maps or similar mapping software.
* Oversee ordering of materials from outside vendors; acting as point-of-contact ensuring delivery and placement; processing related vendor payments.
* Collaborate with the Runner Services (Customer Service), Warehousing, Production, Race Scoring, Staffing / Volunteer, Hospitality, Broadcast and Medical teams to ensure all plans integrate seamlessly into the overall event operation.
* Assist Director and other leaders with Request for Proposal process, bid analysis and budget preparation for all phases of event production
* Develop and maintain event standards (production levels, runner services and amenities, medical, safety, security, communications, technology solutions and contingency plans), standard operating procedures, planning management tools and event analytics for all NYRR races with the goal of optimizing operational efficiencies
* Liaison externally with City Agencies (NYC Parks Dept, Central Park Conservancy, Prospect Park Alliance, NYPD, FDNY, The Mayor’s Office, Department of Transportation, Department of Sanitation, MTA) and local communities to ensure successful operation of NYRR events.
* Liaison internally with departments (Strategic Partnerships, Marketing, Strategy & Planning, IT and Finance) to ensure the entire organization is together on partner deliverables, brand messaging and runner communications, overall organizational strategy and budgets for NYRR event properties
* Other duties and department projects as assigned.

**Job Requirements:***Experience:** Minimum 3 years of event project management experience, preferably in the sports and/or entertainment industries, including a strong logistical/operational and customer service background as well as Run of Show, Scripting and Stage Management Experience.

*Education & Certifications:** College degree in a related field preferred not required

*Skills and Attributes:** Must have event site planning and management experience.
* Working knowledge of event site planning, power, lighting, connectivity and A/V is a plus.
* Previous experience in the NYC event planning landscape is preferred.
* Ability to manage to budget and work within established budgetary guidelines for each event
* Willingness to travel within New York City, work various weekends and extended hours as needed.
* Must have strong leadership skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment; ability to manage part-time staff.
* Focused attention to detail. Ability to effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Works well under pressure and tight deadlines.
* Comfortable presenting to organizational senior management and external City Agencies.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook)
* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

*Physical Requirements:** Ability to lift heavy equipment greater than 25lbs.


Salary: $65,000/year
*NYRR requires all employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 unless approved for a medical or religious exemption.*

title: Youth & Community Events Support (Part-time)
description:
**About NYRR**


New York Road Runners (NYRR) was founded in 1958 when a small group of passionate runners vowed to bring running to the people and has grown from a local running club into the world’s premier community running organization. NYRR’s mission is to help and inspire through running, aiming to empower people of all ages and abilities to improve their health and well-being through the power of running and fitness.


NYRR’s year-round offerings of races, community events, programs, and training resources provide hundreds of thousands of people with the motivation, know-how, and opportunities to start running and keep running for life. NYRR’s premier event, the famed TCS New York City Marathon, attracts the world’s top professional runners and committed amateurs alike, while also raising millions of dollars annually for charity and driving economic impact for New York City. NYRR is equally committed to the runners of tomorrow, passionately providing youth fitness programs that educate and inspire children in underserved communities in New York City, nationwide, and around the world.


Headquartered in New York City, NYRR is a 501(c)(3) organization. To learn more, please visit www.nyrr.org.  

  

At New York Road Runners, we are committed to building an inclusive, diverse workplace by finding the best candidate for the job. We understand that skills come from a variety of different backgrounds. Checking off every single requirement on our job description is not necessary to apply. If you think you are a good fit and have a passion for the work we do, please submit your application. We are eager to learn about your experience and skills! You may be the right candidate for this or other open positions.

**About the Department**

The Community Impact Department encompasses our Youth Programs, Community Programs and Youth Events. NYRR is one of the largest non-profit providers of youth and community fitness programming in New York City (with a growing national/international footprint). The Youth Program team develops, administers, and supports an evolving portfolio of youth running programs and resources used by schools, community centers, and families throughout New York City and nationwide. NYRR's flagship youth program, Rising New York Road Runners, brings the benefits of physical activity to various sites to help children develop the ability, confidence, and desire to be physically active for life. The Community Program team develops, administers, and supports a comprehensive portfolio of programs including our renowned NYRR Striders walking/fitness program for older adults, our NYRR Open Run platform that provides free running and walking racing, and community-building opportunities in parks across the city, and bespoke programs such as NYRR Run for the Future and Youth Ambassadors that provide deep engagement and lifelong skills such as running techniques and public speaking. The Youth Events team oversees the development and execution of over 35 Rising NYRR events per year, including events associated with our Five-Borough Series and the TCS New York City Marathon, each serving 100-1000 or more participants, and the support of other youth and community-based efforts.
**About the Position**

The core responsibility of this position is to provide onsite logistics assistance to more than 50 youth and community events per year, each serving 100-2,500 or more participants.
**Job Responsibilities (primary and secondary duties):*** Perform specific operational duties, as assigned, at each event. Duties may include start, course, finish setup/breakdown, t-shirt, ribbon, or water distribution, officials’ support, bib pickup, family reunion, results, and crowd management.
* Support youth activities based of the Rising New York Road Runners philosophy (training will be provided) at youth and community events.
* Attend virtual and in-person meetings throughout the year to understand the operations of our youth and community events.
* Help with the set-up and breakdown of the event.

**Skills and Attributes:*** Ability to follow directions and execute them properly
* Ability to lift and move event equipment as needed
* Initiative to work independently while simultaneously maintaining a team focus
* Ability to relate to and work with diverse populations is essential
* Heart, humor and a commitment to our organizational mission and vision
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced team-oriented environment.
* Experience in running at any level, including recreational, is preferred

**Other Requirements:*** Travel frequently to various locations throughout NYC on day of events
* Work several weekend days throughout the year with early morning start times and/or several weekday early mornings from March-June, 8:00 a.m. – 1:00 p.m.

**Physical Requirements*** Ability to lift 25lbs.
*New York Road Runners is an Equal Opportunity Employer*


Hourly Rate: $22.00

 *NYRR requires all employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 unless approved for a medical or religious exemption**.*

title: School Nurse
description:
**Location:** Pillar High School, Livingston NJ

**Position:** Full-Time

**Salary:** $83,000/year

**About Us:** Pillar High School has a philosophical approach to meeting the unique needs of students with a wide range of disabilities. As a part of Pillar Care Continuum, we are dedicated to enhancing the lives of people with disabilities and other special needs by supporting personal growth, independence, and participation in the community. We are currently seeking a compassionate and skilled School Nurse to join our team and contribute to the well-being and health of our students.

**Job Overview:** As the School Nurse, you will play a crucial role in promoting health and wellness within our school community. You will be responsible for providing medical care, managing health records, and ensuring compliance with health regulations. Your role will involve working closely with students, parents, and school staff to create a safe and healthy school environment.

**Benefits:** Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Plan, 401k (Up to 4% Match), Term & Whole Life Insurance, Predetermined school breaks/holidays (40 days), Paid Personal Time, Sick Days, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Access to Atlantic Federal Credit Union and NJM Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, Secure Advantage (Financial Literacy), Discount for Lightbridge Academy (Childcare), ADP LifeMart, and Working Advantage (Employee Discounts & more!)

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provides nursing care to students and staff in accordance with New Jersey statutes, regulations, and Department of Education (DOE) guidelines, as well as school policies.
* Administers medication to students in accordance with prescriptions.
* Administration of tube feedings and care of G-Tube site.
* Conduct health screenings and maintain accurate health records.
* Collaborate with others during IEP meetings regarding child’s health needs and concerns.
* Participate in enrollment screening of students to assist in determining the school's ability to meet student's medical needs.
* Serve as an interface between school and medical professionals.
* Educate students and staff on health topics and wellness practices. This may include assisting in participating and/or organizing medical clinics and various screening activities, as well as conducting in-service staff training on health-related items.

**Qualifications:**

* RN License required; graduate of an accredited nursing program licensed in the State of New Jersey
* Minimum of 1 year experience in a school, pediatric, or group home setting
* Certified School Nurse License preferred
* Strong knowledge of health regulations, first aid, and emergency procedures.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with students, parents, and staff.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and remain calm in emergencies
